description: The Microsoft Technology Associate (MTA) is designed to be an entry point into the world of Microsoft certifications, validates building-block technology concepts and helps students explore, discover and pursue successful careers in Information Technology (IT) in an exciting and rewarding way! As the first step in the Microsoft Technology Certification Series, this new, entry-level certification provides students with confidence, credibility, and differentiation while focusing on the knowledge required for the 98-368: MTA Mobility and Devices Fundamentals Exam. One will also focus on desktops, laptops, tablets, cell phones and other devices typically used by an end user because when one first transitions over to IT, one will typically be starting in a role as help desk or desktop support and will need to identify and resolve the issues of such devices. To gain an MTA certification, you must pass only one MTA exam.
name: MTA - Mobility and Devices Fundamentals - 98-368
subtitle: Mobility and Devices Fundamentals

episodes.title: MTA 98-368 - Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don show you how to configure some of the common device options in a Windows desktop environment. Here they explain and demonstrate the benefits of using a Microsoft Account to login to all of your Windows devices. Also covered is the Control Panel and System options that give you the ability to adjust your system devices.
episodes.title: Configure Device Options

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain the ways in which you can customize and configure the desktop settings in the Windows 8.1 operating system. Here you'll learn how to adjust the tiles in the Start Menu, see how different profiles can have different settings for personalization, and how to make settings for entire groups of users through Group Policy.
episodes.title: Configure Desktop Settings

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain the importance of keeping your PC secure by keeping your apps, software, and Windows operating system up-to-date. Here you'll see you how use the Windows Update service to keep your Windows OS patched and optimized as well as some of your device drivers. Also covered is performing App updates.
episodes.title: Configure Updates

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don jump into the topic of Local Storage. They get started by explaining how you can create a large storage system by stringing a bunch of disks together(JBOD) and then moving into more sophisticated solutions like Microsoft's Storage Pools and Storage Spaces.
episodes.title: Storage Part 1

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don help you understand the different filesystems offered in the Windows OS environment. They detail the attributes of the FAT, FAT32, NTFS, and ReFS filesystems; comparing and contrasting how each may be utilized by you in your specific setting.
episodes.title: Storage Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don introduce you to the exciting world of File and Print sharing. They begin by explaining the permissions utilized by the New Technology File System(NTFS) as well as share permissions and how they are applied to define access to a resource. They then move into the different ways in which you can share resources between local and network users via Microsoft HomeGroups, mapped network drives, and shared printers.
episodes.title: File and Print Sharing

episodes.description: In this episode Daniel and Don introduce us to printer sharing. They begin with sharing a locally attached printer for other users on the network to use. They also detail how to manage users' permissions on the printer for delegating tasks.
episodes.title: File and Print Sharing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Daniel and Don break down the technologies behind NTFS and shared permissions. Don demonstrates how to set the permissions on a folder for a user to access, modify, and create new documents. He also explains the ability to block or allow permissions to trickle down.
episodes.title: File and Print Sharing Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain some of the ways that you can secure data using common encryption methods. The start with Microsoft's built-in solutions; the Encrypting File System(EFS) and BitLocker which can be used to encrypt either single files or entire hard drives. Then they explore encryption for data on the move using Virtual Private Networks(VPN), certificates, and SSL.
episodes.title: Data Encryption

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don introduce you to the differences between the concepts of the Internet, and intranet, and an extranet. They then explain the Windows Firewall for protecting you as you move from one network type to another. Lastly they explore the topic of cloud networks.
episodes.title: Device Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don describe the concept of authentication and explain the methods commonly used to that end. Methods like passwords, biometrics, and multifactor authentication are detailed as well as smart cards and Windows Rights Management Services. They also introduce you to the many types of malware that threaten computer systems; both how to differentiate and how to avoid them. Some of the malware types discussed are viruses, trojan horses, spyware, and adware. Then they show you how to avoid, and if need be, disinfect these hazards by utilizing antivirus solutions like Windows Defender.
episodes.title: Device Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie define and contrast the different types of cloud services offered today. Here they explore cloud solutions for storage services, Productivity services, communications services, and search services.
episodes.title: Cloud Services

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explore one of Microsoft's cloud based computer management suites called Intune. Here they show you Intune's capabilities for deploying software, modifying location settings, and even selectively removing apps, software, or the Intune client itself. They also describe Microsoft Azure, which is an enterprise cloud solution. Here they show you how to use Azure to deploy virtual servers and workstations as an extension to your physical environment. They explain how Azure is a great solution for disaster recovery, redundancy, and fault tolerance.
episodes.title: Cloud Services Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain Identity services inside a Microsoft environment, specifically Windows Server Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, and Federation Services. They also explain the concept and implementation of using a Microsoft Account, which allows you to be you no matter what device you're signed into. They also discuss the idea of business data access. Accessing company data from anywhere, especially outside of the business network, is commonplace anymore. Microsoft has deployed solutions like the Company Portal in Intune, Work Folders in Active Directory, and Azure RemoteApp to enable that access to the end user.
episodes.title: Enterprise Mobility

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don introduce you to the concept of the BYOD, or Bring Your Own Device, environment. As more and more personal devices are being used to access private resources, we can use Microsoft solutions to help safely integrate those devices and users. Here we look at methods like virtualization, dynamic access control policies, and Windows Rights management to help make that goal a reality.
episodes.title: Enterprise Mobility Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Mike and Wes introduce Windows RT. They discuss some of the limitations to managing Windows RT devices in an enterprise network through traditional mechanisms. They demonstrate how to manage a Windows RT device through Microsoft Intune. They explore the administrative roles that can be delegated in Microsoft Intune. They also take a look at the compliance and configuration policy processing and explain the results of policy conflicts.
episodes.title: Windows RT

episodes.description: In this episode, Mike and Wes demonstrate how to implement mobile device management of Windows 8 and 8.1 Phone devices. They explain how to enroll Windows 8.1 Phones into Microsoft Intune for mobile device management (MDM). They talk about configuration and compliance policies as well as discussing policy conflicts. They also dive into retiring devices and wiping company data from the after its removed from Microsoft Intune.
episodes.title: Windows Phone
